text: Nice but expensive and not well conserved.
author: 5bfcca8f9e6b162bfd81d7ff

text:
Very nice place, you may ride a horse or a jeep thru this fantastic land, once you go a little bit up on the road you will discover an unbelievable natural habitat for different plants and animals, a river, water falls, creeks, caves, etc. Pretty cool for a family trip.
Very good food at any of the local restaurant on site.
author: 5bfcca8f9e6b162bfd81d7ff

text: A truly special trek through wild Colombia, crossing 4 types of new environment, will not be forgetting this for a while!
author: 5bfcc8759e6b162bfd81d7fe

text:
Hicimos la subida al Nevado del Tolima.
Los guías fueron muy atentos y se nota que les gusta su trabajo.
El desayuno y almuerzo muy ricos.
author: 5bfcc63a5513e72bb32052ce

text: Great value for a day trip!
author: 5bfcca8f9e6b162bfd81d7ff

text: Great price and a must do when visiting Medellin!
author: 5bfcc8759e6b162bfd81d7fe

text: We took this tour because the price was reasonable and we thought it could save us some trouble in getting to Guatapé. However, the guide spoke only in Spanish and the group was composed mainly by local families with kids and elders, which made everything very slow. We arrived at the Piedra de Peñol at the peak hour and we shared the view and photos with flocks of other people. The boat trip and lunch were very average. We ended up visiting Guatapé in only half an hour and for us this was supposed to be the highlight of the day trip. Indeed, the small town seemed very nice but we didn't have enough time to enjoy it.
author: 5bfcc63a5513e72bb32052ce

text: You must know that the Chicamocha cañon is one the most beautiful and impressive place in Colombia, and it's really worth to go.
author: 5bfcc63a5513e72bb32052ce
